snippet: The excitement surrounding the recent reopening of McCarren Park Pool in Brooklyn has been replaced by apprehension.
abstract: Excitement surrounding the reopening of McCarren Park Pool in Brooklyn after 28 years has been replaced by apprehension after several fights and arrests there; pool has brought long restless lines, racially charged debates and complaints that the city should have committed resources to the opening, from sanitation to security.

byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein, Juliet Linderman and Eric P. Newcomer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The excitement surrounding the recent reopening of McCarren Park Pool in Brooklyn has been replaced by apprehension.

headline.seo: Problems at McCarren Park Pool Have a Neighborhood Worried
headline.main: A Revived Pool Draws Tensions to the Surface
headline.print_headline: For Neighborhood in Flux, Tensions Surface at a Revived City Pool
